blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling time units and simulation start date.

variables.name: TIME_UNITS
variables.description: Time units used throughout the simulation.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the time units for all stress period lengths and time step calculations. Must be consistent with all input data. DAYS is the most common choice.

variables.name: START_DATE_TIME
variables.description: Starting date and time for the simulation in ISO 8601 format.
variables.tooltip: Optional calendar reference date for the simulation start. Used for labeling output but does not affect calculations. Format example: 2020-01-01T00:00:00.

blocks.name: DIMENSIONS
blocks.description: Dimensions defining the number of stress periods.

variables.name: NPER
variables.description: Number of stress periods in the simulation.
variables.tooltip: Defines how many stress periods the simulation contains. Each stress period can have different boundary conditions, sources, and sinks. Must be greater than or equal to 1.

blocks.name: PERIODDATA
blocks.description: Stress period timing data defining the length, number of time steps, and time step multiplier for each stress period.

variables.name: PERLEN
variables.description: Length of the stress period, in the time units specified in OPTIONS.
variables.tooltip: Duration of the stress period. For steady-state stress periods, PERLEN can be any positive value (commonly 1.0). For transient periods, it defines the actual simulated time.

variables.name: NSTP
variables.description: Number of time steps within the stress period.
variables.tooltip: The stress period is divided into NSTP time steps. More time steps provide finer temporal resolution but increase computation time. Minimum is 1.

variables.name: TSMULT
variables.description: Time step multiplier for geometric progression of time step lengths.
variables.tooltip: Each successive time step is TSMULT times the previous one. A value of 1.0 produces equal time steps. Values > 1.0 create progressively longer steps (common: 1.2 to 1.5). Must be > 0.
